Coin tosses are the epitome of gambling. With exactly 50-50 probability of either outcome, they represent "fairness" between two parties. In machine learning context, they are frequently used to compare bad models.

> *Is this model worse than a coin toss?*

I want to check if a coin toss is actually better than a model with bad accuracy metrics.
